required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Sperm DNA Integrity on Artificial Reproductive Treatment (ART)
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Sperm DNA Integrity on ART Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to establish a new criteria with which to judge the quality of sperm samples submitted for artificial reproductive treatments. It is believed that this type of testing can compliment the traditional semen analysis to better drive patient care.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Study funding was withdrawn by the sponsor following agreement that slow patient recruitment warranted a new approach.
clinical_study.condition: Sperm DNA Impact on ART Outcomes

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing routine semen analysis as part of their infertility treatment pertaining to success or failure with intrauterine insemination, based upon their sperm DNA integrity
Couples undergoing routine screening prior to IVF retrievals to assess their reproductive treatment outcomes as compared to the sperm DNA integrity

biospec_descr.textblock: Smears of semen samples will be stained and stored.

study_pop.textblock: patient population at the Center for Human Reproduction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- needs interventions through artificial reproductive treatment to achieve a pregnancy
Exclusion Criteria:
- severly oligozoospermic patients
